snippet: A $6 fee that helped reduce driving in the city center was eliminated with a ruling that upheld the appeal of a parking garage that had lost business because of the measure.
abstract: Italian administrative court suspends Milan's congestion charge, upholding an appeal by Mediolanum Parking, which had complained that the $6 fee hurt business; during the six months when the charge was enforced, traffic within the zone decreased by 34 percent and overall traffic in Milan by 7 percent; the money raised was tagged for more public transport, bike lanes and parking lots outside the city center.
lead_paragraph: A $6 fee that helped reduce driving in the city center was eliminated with a ruling that upheld the appeal of a parking garage that had lost business because of the measure.

headline.seo: Ruling Halts an Effort to Reduce Traffic in Milan
headline.main: Effort to Cut Milan Traffic Halted as Court Favors Garage
headline.print_headline: Effort to Cut Milan Traffic Halted as Court Favors Garage
